result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaden Martin Raatz

records.addlTxt:
3:52 PM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court, in custody.   Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are:  22CF126, 22CF186, 22CF280, 22CM74 and 22CM77.

Court calls the cases.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
22CF126:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 

22CF186:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Guilty

22CF280:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Guilty 
Count 6 - Guilty 

22CM74:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 

22CM77:
Count 1 - Guilty 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 22CM77:  Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) 943.50(1m)(b) & (4a), guilty of Count 1 in 22CF186: Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer 346.04(3), guilty of Count 2 in 22CF186:  Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b), guilty of Count 3 in 22CF186:   Bail Jumping - Felony 946.49(1)(b), guilty of Count 5 in 22CF186:  Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) 943.50(1m)(b) & (4a), guilty of Count 5 in 22CF280:  Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor  946.49(1)(a) and guilty of Count 6 in 22CF280:  Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor  946.49(1)(a) 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:
22CM74:   Count 1
22CF126:  Count 1
22CF186:  Count 4
22CF280:  Count 1, 2, 3 & 4 

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Court asks if M.M. is in the courtroom - she does appear at today's hearing.
M.M. makes a statement to the Court with regards to the $500 cash bond she posted and is no longer asking that it be returned to her.
4:33 p.m.  Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court will allow Atty Jakobson to preserve what he was putting on the record with regards to expungement.
Court will hold open the issue on expungement; Court will not rule on this today.
Atty Jakobson to put this in writing and file with the Court; State will be allowed to respond.
Atty Jakobson's client will not be arguing the restitution that is being requested.
4:43 p.m.  Court questions the defendant.
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CM77:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 2 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

22CF186:
Count 1 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 5 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Conditional Jail of 170 Days in the Portage County Jail
Jail Credit of 167 Days 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not knowingly associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Not be on the premises of the trailer park as stated on the record 
No contact with Fleet Farm 
No contact with Dylan Worden or Haley Erickson 
Participate in any treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time. 
Pay restitution in the amount of $289.99 in 22CM77 to Fleet Farm - to be paid first from the cash bond 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

Count 2:  
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 5 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

Count 3:  
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 5 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

Count 5:
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 2 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

22CF280:
Count 5 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 2 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

Count 6 -
Sentence Withheld 
Placed on Probation for a Period of 2 Years -
**Conditions of Probation:
Comply with the conditions of probation in Count 1 of 22CF186
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample 

Counts concurrent with each other
Filed by Prosecutor.

Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz in court, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are: 22CF-126, 22CF-186, 22CF-280, 22CM-74, 22CM-77.

11:44 AM Court calls cases. 
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

This was the date and time set for a plea and sentencing. 
Parties have engaged in discussion.
Atty Jakobson addresses the Court as to legal opinion given to his client from another attorney as to pleas/expungements in other counties.
Defendant would be entitled to appeal the conviction in Adams County.  
Defense requests a date next week to continue.
Court questions parties regarding these cases. 
Discussions continue.

Court has time this afternoon to continue. Does not work for Defense. 

State is in compliance with victim notification statutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 10/21/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am. (Corrected date)

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Oren Jakobson is present and will be appointed to this new case.  
Atty Jakobson requests his other cases 22CF126, 22CF186, 22CM74, and 22CM77 be set for a pretrial conference on 08-08-2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No contact with D. W. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
If any bond is posted, may be applied to either 22CF-126 and 22CF-186.

11:05 AM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Soule appears in court.
Cases heard for warrants are 22CF-126 and 22CF-186. Hearing set for 22CM-74 and 22CM-77 for which warrants are pending.

Court calls cases.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

State requests warrants quashed.
Court questions how Defendant was picked up.
State does not how Defendant was picked up.

BY THE COURT:
Warrants will not be quashed unless the State can give a reason.

Court questions Atty Mutchler further.
State explains further.
Atty Mutchler requests that it is standard practice for warrants be quashed, due to Defendant's appearance today.

State requests bonds be amended in 22CF-126 and 22CF-186 to $10,000 cash each, for reasons stated.
Atty Soule cannot speak on Defendant's behalf, Defendant refused to speak to her.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.
Bond is ordered.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:26 PM Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz not in court. Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz.  Cases 22CF126 and 22CF186.
State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant - body only
Filed by Prosecutor.
Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz appeared by video.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz. Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
22CM74 and 22CM77:
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Bonds set in 22CM74 and 22CM77.
BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued in 22CF126 and 22CF186.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kaden Martin Raatz not in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Kaden Martin Raatz. 
All files heard: 22CF126, 22CM74, 22CM77

Atty Jakobson makes statements.  He was recently appointed.  He spoke with the Adams County jail and he was transferred to a juvenile facility but he was unable to learn which one.  Asks to adjourn. 
Court questions Atty Jakobson if he is authorized to appear on the misdemeanor charges. 
Atty Jakobson states he is not at this time. 

Court adjourns the matters.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Jakobson.

Initial Appearance set for April 4, 2022 @ 2 p.m. in Br 2

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelley Cassidy  appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy  states facts for anticipated charges of Aggervated Battery. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 

BY THE COURT: Court sets bond

No contact with D. W.
